jobDesc:
Job Title: MERN Stack Developer
Job Description:

We are looking for a passionate and experienced MERN Stack Developer to build modern, scalable web applications. You will work on end-to-end development using MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, and Node.js, contributing to design, development, testing, and deployment.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain full-stack web applications using the MERN stack

Design RESTful APIs and integrate front-end with back-end services

Optimize applications for performance and scalability

Collaborate with UI/UX designers, product managers, and other developers

Write clean, maintainable, and testable code

Requirements:

1–3 years of hands-on experience in MERN stack development

Strong knowledge of JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3

Experience with Git, REST APIs, and MongoDB queries

Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS is a plus

Good understanding of OOPs and SDLC principles

questions: Explain your experience optimizing MongoDB queries and data models for performance in a high-traffic application.
Describe a complex React.js component you've built, detailing state management and performance considerations.
Detail your experience securing Express.js APIs. How did you implement authentication and authorization?
answers:
"One of the most complex React components I built was a dynamic form builder used in an internal dashboard. It allowed users to create forms by dragging and dropping various input types (text, date, radio, etc.)."

State Management:
I used useReducer to manage the form state because it involved nested structures — sections → fields → validations. This allowed better control and cleaner updates than useState.

Performance Optimizations:

Used React.memo and useCallback to prevent unnecessary re-renders of individual form fields.

Applied lazy loading of heavy components like date pickers using React.lazy().

Added debouncing for autosave functionality using lodash.debounce.
